recipe.Ingredients:
For the Schnitzel: 
- 4 boneless pork chops 
- Salt and pepper to taste 
- 1 cup all-purpose flour 
- 2 large eggs 
- 2 cups breadcrumbs 
- 1 lemon (cut into wedges) 
- Vegetable oil for frying

For the Side Vegetables: 
- 2 cups green beans (trimmed) 
- 2 medium carrots (peeled and sliced) 
- 1 red bell pepper (sliced) 
- 2 tbsp olive oil 
- Salt and pepper to taste 
- 2 cloves garlic (minced)
recipe.Instructions:
1. Place the pork chops between two pieces of plastic wrap and gently pound them to about 1/4 inch thickness using a meat mallet or rolling pin. Season with salt and pepper.
2. Set up three shallow bowls: one with flour, one with beaten eggs, and one with breadcrumbs.
3. Dredge each pork chop in the flour, shaking off the excess, then dip in the beaten eggs, and coat with breadcrumbs. Press the breadcrumbs evenly onto the pork.
4. Heat about 1/4 inch of vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry the pork chops in batches until golden brown and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes per side. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
5. For the side vegetables, preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Toss the green beans, carrots, and red bell pepper in olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper. Spread them out on a baking sheet.
6. Roast the vegetables in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, until tender and slightly caramelized.
7. Serve the Schnitzel hot with lemon wedges and the roasted vegetables on the side.

recipes.comment: Your recipe has been saved as 'German Fried Pork'! You can now access it anytime.
